member.name: T:Octokit.IOauthClient
member.summary: Provides methods used in the OAuth web flow.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOauthClient.GetGitHubLoginUrl(Octokit.OauthLoginRequest)
member.summary: Gets the URL used in the first step of the web flow. The Web application should redirect to this URL.
member.param: Parameters to the Oauth web flow login url

member.name: M:Octokit.IOauthClient.CreateAccessToken(Octokit.OauthTokenRequest)
member.summary: Makes a request to get an access token using the code returned when GitHub.com redirects back from the URL GitHub login url to the application.
member.remarks: If the user accepts your request, GitHub redirects back to your site with a temporary code in a code parameter as well as the state you provided in the previous step in a state parameter. If the states don’t match, the request has been created by a third party and the process should be aborted. Exchange this for an access token using this method.

member.name: P:Octokit.OauthLoginRequest.Scopes
member.summary: A set of scopes to request. If not provided, scope defaults to an empty list of scopes for users that don’t have a valid token for the app. For users who do already have a valid token for the app, the user won’t be shown the OAuth authorization page with the list of scopes. Instead, this step of the flow will automatically complete with the same scopes that were used last time the user completed the flow.
member.remarks: See the scopes documentation for more information about scopes.

member.summary: Matches files with a certain extension.

member.summary: Searching Repositories http://developer.github.com/v3/search/#search-repositories

member.summary: The search terms. This can be any combination of the supported repository search parameters: http://developer.github.com/v3/search/#search-repositories

member.summary: For https://help.github.com/articles/searching-repositories#sorting Optional Sort field. One of stars, forks, or updated. If not provided, results are sorted by best match.

member.summary: Sort order one of asc or desc - the default is desc.

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Page
member.summary: Page of paginated results

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.PerPage
member.summary: Number of items per page

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.In
member.summary: The in qualifier limits what fields are searched. With this qualifier you can restrict the search to just the repository name, description, README, or any combination of these. Without the qualifier, only the name and description are searched. https://help.github.com/articles/searching-repositories#search-in

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Forks
member.summary: Filters repositories based on the number of forks, and/or whether forked repositories should be included in the results at all. https://help.github.com/articles/searching-repositories#forks

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Fork
member.summary: Filters repositories based whether forked repositories should be included in the results at all. Defaults to ExcludeForks https://help.github.com/articles/searching-repositories#forks

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Size
member.summary: The size qualifier finds repository's that match a certain size (in kilobytes). https://help.github.com/articles/searching-repositories#size

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Language
member.summary: Searches repositories based on the language they’re written in. https://help.github.com/articles/searching-repositories#languages

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Stars
member.summary: Searches repositories based on the number of stars. https://help.github.com/articles/searching-repositories#stars

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.User
member.summary: Limits searches to a specific user or repository. https://help.github.com/articles/searching-repositories#users-organizations-and-repositories

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Created
member.summary: Filters repositories based on times of creation. https://help.github.com/articles/searching-repositories#created-and-last-updated

member.name: P:Octokit.SearchRepositoriesRequest.Updated
member.summary: Filters repositories based on when they were last updated. https://help.github.com/articles/searching-repositories#created-and-last-updated

member.summary: get the params in the correct format...

member.name: T:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient
member.summary: A client for GitHub's Organization Members API.
member.remarks: See the Orgs API documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient.GetAll(System.String)

summary.para: List all users who are members of an organization. A member is a user that belongs to at least 1 team in the organization.
If the authenticated user is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public member will be returned.
If the requester is not an owner of the organization the query will be redirected to the public members list.

member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient.GetAll(System.String,System.String)

summary.para: List all users who are members of an organization. A member is a user that belongs to at least 1 team in the organization.
If the authenticated user is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public member will be returned.
If the requester is not an owner of the organization the query will be redirected to the public members list.

member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.
member.param: The filter to use when getting the users

member.name: M:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient.GetPublic(System.String)
member.summary: List all users who have publicized their membership of the organization.
member.remarks: http://developer.github.com/v3/orgs/members/#public-members-list

member.name: M:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient.CheckMember(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Check if a user is, publicly or privately, a member of the organization.
member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient.CheckMemberPublic(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Check is a user is publicly a member of the organization.
member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient.Delete(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Removes a user from the organization, this will also remove them from all teams within the organization and they will no longer have any access to the organization's repositories.
member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient.Publicize(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Make the authenticated user's organization membership public.
member.remarks: This method requires authentication. See the API documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Octokit.IOrganizationMembersClient.Conceal(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Make the authenticated user's organization membership private.

member.name: M:Octokit.OrganizationMembersClient.GetAll(System.String)

summary.para: List all users who are members of an organization. A member is a user that belongs to at least 1 team in the organization.
If the authenticated user is also an owner of this organization then both concealed and public member will be returned.
If the requester is not an owner of the organization the query will be redirected to the public members list.

member.remarks: See the API documentation for more information.

member.name: M:Octokit.AuthorizationExtensions.GetOrCreateApplicationAuthentication(Octokit.IAuthorizationsClient,System.String,System.String,Octokit.NewAuthorization,System.Func{Octokit.TwoFactorRequiredException,System.Threading.Tasks.Task{Octokit.TwoFactorChallengeResult}})
member.summary: This method will create a new authorization for the specified OAuth application, only if an authorization for that application doesn’t already exist for the user. It returns the user’s token for the application if one exists. Otherwise, it creates a new one.

remarks.para: This method allows the caller to provide a callback which is used to retrieve the two-factor code from the user. Typically the callback is used to show some user interface to the user.
See API documentation for more details.

member.param: Client ID for the OAuth application that is requesting the token
Defines the scopes and metadata for the token
Callback used to retrieve the two-factor authentication code from the user

member.name: T:Octokit.RateLimitExceededException
member.summary: Exception thrown when GitHub API Rate limits are exceeded.

summary.para: For requests using Basic Authentication or OAuth, you can make up to 5,000 requests per hour. For unauthenticated requests, the rate limit allows you to make up to 60 requests per hour.

member.name: P:Octokit.RateLimitExceededException.Limit
member.summary: The maximum number of requests that the consumer is permitted to make per hour.

member.name: P:Octokit.RateLimitExceededException.Remaining
member.summary: The number of requests remaining in the current rate limit window.

member.name: P:Octokit.RateLimitExceededException.Reset
member.summary: The date and time at which the current rate limit window resets

member.name: T:Octokit.SimpleJson
member.summary:
This class encodes and decodes JSON strings. Spec. details, see http://www.json.org/
JSON uses Arrays and Objects. These correspond here to the datatypes JsonArray(IList<object>) and JsonObject(IDictionary<string,object>). All numbers are parsed to doubles.

member.name: M:Octokit.SimpleJson.DeserializeObject(System.String)
member.summary: Parses the string json into a value
member.returns: An IList<object>, a IDictionary<string,object>, a double, a string, null, true, or false

member.name: M:Octokit.SimpleJson.TryDeserializeObject(System.String,System.Object@)
member.summary: Try parsing the json string into a value.
member.returns: Returns true if successfull otherwise false.

member.name: M:Octokit.SimpleJson.SerializeObject(System.Object,Octokit.IJsonSerializerStrategy)
member.summary: Converts a IDictionary<string,object> / IList<object> object into a JSON string
member.returns: A JSON encoded string, or null if object 'json' is not serializable
